thread.title: UT volleyball starts road trip with loss
thread.title_full: UT volleyball starts road trip with loss

title: UT volleyball starts road trip with loss
text:
UT volleyball starts road trip with loss News Sentinel staff 11:01 PM, Oct 23, 2015   Show Caption Next 
Tennessee's volleyball road trip to the state of Mississippi started with a loss Friday night. 
Ole Miss beat the Vols 25-21, 21-25, 25-13, 25-21 at the Gillom Sports Center in Oxford, Miss. 
The Vols (18-6, 4-5 SEC) took the second set, but Ole Miss (18-6, 4-4) reclaimed momentum in the third set and won a close fourth set. 
Junior Bri Holmes paced the Vols' offense with 14 kills, the ninth time she has led Tennessee this season. Junior Kanisha Jimenez had six kills, seven digs and five blocks. 
Ole Miss had a .248 hitting percentage in the match while Tennessee hit .135, including -.033 in the fourth set. The Rebels also out-dug Tennessee 54 to 45 and had four players in double figures for kills. 
Tennessee will complete the road weekend against Mississippi State at 1 p.m. Sunday. The match will be televised on the SEC Network. 
Men's Tennis: Three Tennessee players advanced in singles to start the SEC Fall Classic in Auburn, Ala. 
Igor Smelyanski and fellow sophomore Luis Valero reached the quarterfinals of the A draw, and freshman Jack Heslin recorded a pair of straight-set wins to reach the quarterfinals in the B draw. 
The Vols also had two teams advance to the doubles quarterfinals. 
Smelyanski scored a 6-1, 3-6, 7-5 win over Marko Krickovic of host Auburn. He followed with a 6-4, 6-1 win against Trevor Foshey of Mississippi State. 
Smelyanski, who won 11 matches in his freshman year, is now a team-leading 15-2 this fall. 
Valero needed just one victory to make the quarterfinals. He beat South Carolina's Gabriel Friedrich 6-4, 6-2 and then advanced to the quarterfinals when Arkansas' top returner, Giammarco Micolani, withdrew with injury. 
Heslin lost just five games in two matches en route to the B draw quarterfinals. 
The two Tennessee doubles teams in the A draw advanced to the quarterfinals. Valero and Jack Schipanski ousted the fourth-seeded Arkansas team of Giammarco Micolani and Jose Salazar, 8-3. Smelyanski and Preston Touliatos improved to 4-0 this fall with an 8-5 win against Ole Miss' Filip Kraljevic and Fabian Fallert.
